content: FhirShield.com is for sale. I have the ownership. Anyone can buy from me.

yes. you can own any of the infinite number of domains that have fhir in their name, but if you want to use them, you need trademark permission from HL7. Note that HL7 policy precludes using "FHIR" in your company name; you can only use it in the names of products (e.g. libraries, services) and events

Does this not come under the restriction against advertising as discussed here: https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/35-fmg-(members.20only)/topic/Limitation.20on.20forum.20use.20for.20marketing ? (Quite apart from the distaste I have for cyber squatting - I'm assuming this has a 'for profit' intention )
presumeably that's why it's being discussed, but it's not a rule now

No no. Firstly, most respectfully my intention was not for profit purposes. If it is against any policy my mistake then I extremely apologize for that. I really really don't want to be in any rule violence I am really really sorry that.

Secondly I am not going to use fhir in any of the company name.

We have bought two domains for the product I mention that for the product not for the company as stated above. So we finalized one of them and I just thought to sell the another one. So I just posted here. If I known before I would surely would not have posted here.

I really apologize for that again.
I would also go through all the proper channels and will read and acknowledge all the trademark policy.

@Muhammad Abubakar that clarification helps significantly. If anyone wants your unneeded domain, they can certainly respond to you by PM. If the name you have chosen includes the word FHIR, just make sure to fill out the FHIR licensing request.
@Lloyd McKenzie Thanks for the acknowledgment. Of course we will do.
glad to have that clarified! Hope it works out for you...
